[DI28034] Indianapolis Star, Friday Nov 20, 1981 Pg57

Luther William Nuckols, Sr, 59, 7818 Jennifer Driver, died Thursday in his home. A WW II Army Veteran, he had been custodian two years at North Central High School, retiring in May. A native of Forks of Buffalo, VA he lived in Indianapolis most of his life and was a member of American Legeon Post 152 at Knightstown. Services will be held at 11 a.m. Saturday in Wilson St Pierre Chapel of the Chimes where friends may call after 4 today. Survivors includes his wife, Patti Arakawa Nuckols; three sons, Kimberly D, Terry L and Luther W Nuckols Jr; two daughters, Sharon Turner and Wanda Palmore; two step sons, Michael and David Arakawa and a step daughter Teresa Arakawa. [DI28035] Luther William Nuckols, Jr.

67, Indianapolis, passed away Saturday, July, 23, 2011. Luther was born on July 28, 1943 in Indianapolis to the late Luther William and Helen Louise (Jacobs) Nuckols, Sr. He married his love Anna Marie Warmouth on February 28, 2007 in Indianapolis.Luther was a Police Officer for at least 25 years. He initiated his career with the Clermont Police Force. He worked with the Wayne Township Fire Department, the Marion County Sheriff's Department, the Wayne Township Constable's Office, and was currently a Deputy with the Constable's Office. Luther was also a devoted member of the American Legion Post #64 in Indianapolis. Luther loved karaoke.Luther is survived by his loving wife Anna of 4 years; children: David Nuckols (Laurie); Brian Nuckols; Robert Nuckols (Stephanie); Jerry Nuckols (Angel); Carla Henderson; and Amanda Mascoe (John); step-son Craig Short; brothers: Terry Nuckols (Mary) and Kim Nuckols (Chris); sister Sharon Sheppard (Jim); 17 grandchildren; and 6 great- grandchildren.Luther was preceded in death by his parents and sister Wanda Daniels.Visitation will be on Wednesday, July 27, 2011 from 11:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. at Forest Lawn Funeral Home, 1977 S. State Rd. 135, Greenwood. The funeral service will immediately follow at 1:00 p.m. with Pastor Mike Messer officiating. Memorial contributions may be made to the American Cancer Society and/or the American Legion Post #64. If you would like to sign the online guest book, send condolences to the family, and/or watch Luther's video tribute you may do so by visiting http://www.forestlawncemetery-fh.com.Published in the The Indianapolis Star on July 26, 2011

[DI28049] Daily News-Record (Harrisonburg, VA) - March 7, 2008

Shirley Temple Nuckols Smith, age 60, of Laurinburg, N.C., passed away on Thursday, March 6, 2008, at her home.A Graveside service will be held at Greenwood Cemetery in Dunn, N.C., at 2 p.m. on Saturday, March 8.

Mrs. Smith was born on July 27, 1947, in Richmond, Va., the daughter of the late Minnie Lane and Alonzo C. Nuckols. She was a devoted mother, sister and friend.She was preceded in death by her brother, Thomas M. Nuckols.Mrs. Smith leaves behind to cherish her memory her son, Thomas Smith of South Carolina.; a daughter, Sandra Moser and Husband Bryan of Dunn, N.C.; a brother, James Nuckols of Virginia; and sisters, Madeline Wachter of Laurinburg, N.C., and Louise Butler of Ashland, Va.; a special friend, Clyde Adams of Laurinburg, N.C.; and four grandchildren.Richard Boles Funeral Service of Laurinburg, N.C., is serving the Smith family.

[DI28094] Daily Breeze (Torrance, CA) - March 9, 2008

Deceased Name: Karen Joyce Crutcher Nuchols

Torrance CA United States

Karen Joyce Nuchols-Crutcher, 49 of Lakewood, CA, passed away February 28, 2008 with her family at her side, after a two year battle with cancer. She was born November 13, 1958, in Lancaster, CA, and spent most of her childhood in Torrance, CA, graduating from West High School in 1976. Karen had one child, Kaylene Ross, born August 16, 1982. She married Lynn Crutcher, August 30, 1985, and helped him raise five step-children. She worked alongside her father at McCarthy Draying Co. - starting as an office manager and eventually becoming the President and Co-Owner with Lynn. Karen retired in 2006 and split her time between her house in Lakewood and her dream home in Procter, British Columbia, Canada. Lynn & Karen built it from the ground up over the last 15 years. An animal lover, she adopted and found homes for many strays over the years. Karen touched the lives of many people through both her positive attitude and her gourmet cooking. She is survived and will be deeply missed by her parents, John and LaFaun Nuchols of Torrance; her loving husband, Lynn; her daughter, Kaylene & son-in-law, Chris Cottgias; stepchildren, Amber, Heather (Victor) & her granddaughter, Annaliese, Tad, Scott & Crystal; along with her three siblings, Beverly Nuchols (Arthur) & nieces Sophia & Ali, John F. Nuchols (Denise) & nieces Jayni, Jaclyn & Joyce, Steve Nuchols (Laura) & nephews Steven J., Austin & nieces Morgan & Lauren. In lieu of flowers, memorial donations may be made in Karen's name to the USC Radiation Oncology Association at P.O. Box 31169, Los Angeles, CA 90031-0169. Please specify "In memory of Karen Crutcher" in the memo portion of your check so that the donations are directed to head and neck cancer research. Please sign the guest book at www.dailybreeze.com/obits.

HAMPTON - Dorothy M. Camden, 83, widow of Emory Camden, died peacefully Friday, Aug. 6, 2010, with her family by her side. Born in Lynchburg she had been a Hampton resident since 1956.

Dorothy was a loving wife, mother, grandmother and friend. She is survived by her son, Clifton Camden and wife, Maureen; daughters, Brenda Morrissett and Patricia Watts; sisters-in-law, Nancy Moore, Mary Ann Myrsten, June Camden and Marjorie Camden; eight grandchildren and 12 great-grandchildren; and many loving nieces and nephews.

A funeral service will be conducted at 11 a.m. Wednesday, Aug. 11, 2010, at R. Hayden Smith Funeral Home with interment to follow in Hampton Memorial Gardens. The family will receive friends Tuesday from 7 to 8 p.m. at the funeral home.

The family requests that memorial donations be sent to the Alzheimer's Association . View and post condolences on our online guestbook at dailypress.com/guestbooks.

Published in Daily Press from August 9 to August 10, 2010

[DI28154] ohn Coleman Nuckolls, 78, of Stuarts Draft, passed away on Saturday, November 17, 2012, at his residence. He was born on February 9, 1934, in Greenville, the son of the late Willie and Annie Nuckoles. In addition to his parents, he was also preceded in death by a brother-in-law, Wilbur Fretwell; and nephew, Bill Scott Nuckoles. John, an eight year veteran served in Okinawa as an Air Policeman and finished his service at the Pentagon. He retired from the United States Postal Service with 26 years, all served on Route 1, Stuarts Draft. He was Secretary of the old Stuarts Draft Moose Lodge, past Post Commander of Stuarts Draft VFW 9339, also bingo manager for 35 years. On August 3, 1979, he married Janet Fretwell Nuckolls who survives. In addition to his wife, he is survived by sons, John "Curt" Nuckolls of Staunton and Dwaine Nuckolls of Middlebrook; daughters, Sharon Jane Nuckolls Shelley and husband, Richard, of Glen Allen, June Cline of Stuarts Draft, and Treva Massie and husband, Jimmy, of Stuarts Draft; brothers, William O. Nuckoles and Lawrence "Pete" Nuckoles; grandchildren, JR Nuckolls, Josh Nuckolls, Randy Cline, Katie Nuckolls and Paula Davis; a number of great-grandchildren, nieces and nephews. Special daughter, Lisa Tidd Bensen and husband, Robbie. He will also be missed by his fishing buddy of 40+ years, John Nelson, and partner in crime, Butch Bentley; a special friend, Ralph Oakes and his latest "girlfriend", Sophia Faith, and John's family at the VFW bingo. The family will receive friends from 6 until 8 p.m. Monday, November 19, 2012, at the Reynolds Hamrick Funeral Homes of Stuarts Draft. A graveside service will be conducted 2 p.m. Tuesday, November 20, 2012, at Stuarts Draft Mennonite Church Cemetery with Pastor Earl Monroe officiating. Stuarts Draft VFW 9339 will conduct military rites at the service. Active pallbearers will be John Nelson, Josh Nuckolls, JR Nuckolls, Randy Cline, Jerry Harris and Jerry Robert Harris. Honorary pallbearers will be men and women of the Stuarts Draft VFW 9339. In lieu of flowers, those desiring may make donations to Stuarts Draft VFW 9339, 3251 Stuarts Draft Highway, Stuarts Draft, VA 24477. John and Charley Weaver are together now solving the world's problems. Family and friends may view the obituary on line at www.reynoldshamrickfuneralhomes.com.

[DI28155] Mary Jane (Kemp) Nuckolls Mary Jane (Kemp) Nuckolls died in Waynesboro, Virginia, on Tuesday, April 30, 2013, after a short illness. She was born on August 15, 1934, in Reading, Pennsylvania. Mary served honorably in the United States Air Force and was proud to do so. She worked at the former Crompton for 21 years, Smith Transfer four years and Intelos Phone Company for four years. She is survived by her daughter, Sharon Nuckolls (Shelley); sons, Dwaine and Curt Nuckolls; brothers, Ben (Joan) Kemp and Mike (Minnie) Kemp; grandchildren, Katelynn, JR and Joshua Nuckolls. Donations may be made to the American Cancer Society

[DI28162] RALEIGH, N.C. '96 Debra "Debbie" Marie Nuckoles, 57, passed on Friday, Jan. 9, 2015, surrounded by family after a long courageous battle with breast cancer, at Transitions LifeCare Hospice in Raleigh, North Carolina.

Debbie was born Oct. 2, 1957, in Houston, a daughter of William and Freda Nuckoles, of Stuarts Draft, Virginia.Debbie was proceeded in death by a brother Bill Scott Nuckoles.In addition to her parents Debbie is survived by her identical twin sister, Sue Barchers, of Staunton, Virginia; brother and wife, Robert and Cindy Nuckoles, of Stuarts Draft, Virginia; brother and wife, Jim and Beth Nuckoles, of Portland, Tennessee; daughter and husband, Shawna and Mike VandenHeuvel, grandsons, Jonathan and Alexander, of Cary, North Carolina; daughter and husband, Tiffany Weaver and Kris Stein, of Arlington, Virginia; son, Kyle Biggs, of Wilmington, North Carolina; son and wife, Mitchell and Alexis Biggs, of Carthage, North Carolina; and many loved nieces, friends and extended family.Debbie proudly served her country in the U.S. Air Force. Debbie enjoyed being outdoors '97 whether in her beloved mustang or riding motorcycles with her brother Robert. Debbie's energy, caring, strength and perseverance inspired all those around her.The family will receive friends at the home of her parents, William and Freda Nuckoles 1703 Cold Springs Road, Stuarts Draft, Virginia, at 4 p.m. Tuesday, Jan. 13, 2015.Cremation is planned under the care of City of Oaks Cremation of Raleigh, North Carolina. A private family celebration will be held in the spring per Debbie's wishes.In lieu of flowers, please consider making a donation in her memory to Transitions LifeCare Hospice, 250 Hospice Circle, Raleigh, NC 27607 or Susan B. Komen Foundation.

[DI28176] Published in Springfield News-Sun on October 9, 2011

STEPHENSON, Mildred Joyce 83, of Springfield, passed away October 7, 2011 in Essex of Springfield. She was born April 23, 1928 in Virginia, the daughter of William and Ava Nuckols Sr. Joyce enjoyed playing games and working puzzles. She had been employed as night manager at Fulmer's Supermarket. Survivors include three sons; Charles Edward (Lucinda) Stephenson Jr., Virginia, Robert Eugene (Allison) Stephenson, Wisconsin and James Francis (Cindy) Stephenson, Florida, daughter-in-law; Nickilynn Stephenson, Springfield, numerous grandchildren and great grandchildren and one brother; William (Molly) Nuckols Jr., Virginia. She was preceded in death by her husband; Charles Edward Stephenson Sr. and one son William Lee Stephenson. Private services will be held at the convenience of the family. Joyce's family would like to give special thanks to the staff at Essex of Springfield and Acclaim Hospice for all of their loving care and kindness. Arrangements are being handled by the JONES-KENNEY-ZECHMAN FUNERAL HOME.

[DI28342] Bradford Lawson, age 95, of Morristown, TN., passed away May 11, 2010 at the Morristown-Hamblen Healthcare. He was born July 24, 1914, a son of the late Wilk and Fannie Brock Lawson. He believed in the Baptist faith and had been a school bus driver for the Bell County School System. He had served in the United States Army during World War II.In addition to his parents he was preceded in death by his brothers, Ardill Lawson, Ewell Lawson, Richard Lawson, John Lawson and Arthur Lawson; sisters, Bessie Helton, Clora Meredith, LouAnna Sizemore, Debbie Brock, Susie Schutte and Chanie Huge.Survivors include his wife of 62 years, Ethel Helton Lawson, children and their spouses, Ronald and Sandra Lawson, Bonnie Jean and Rick Warren, Jeweldean and George Surface, Brenda Kay and Randall Ridley, Donnie and Dolly Lawson and Stanley and Marlene Lawson; brother, Edward Lawson; sister, Marie Wilcox; nine grandchildren and twelve great-grandchildren, and a host of nieces, nephews, other relatives and friends.

[DI28343] Bertha Woolum Slusher, 96, of Arjay, passed away on Wednesday, July 15, 2009 at the University of Kentucky Medical Center in Lexington. Born in Rella, KY on June 8, 1913, she was the daughter of the late John and Catherine Tiechor Woolum. A member of Dean Memorial Baptist Church, she had been a homemaker.

In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Millard F. Slusher, children, Larry Franklin Slusher, Bradley Slusher, Mable Hatton and Sallie Mae Hinson and a host of brothers and sisters.

Survivors include her children, Pauline Caldwell King, Alma Sue Kinnard, Alta Sadow, Doris Ann Stobaugh, Ray E. Slusher, Randall G. Slusher and Dale R. Slusher, twenty grandchildren nine great-grandchildren, five great-great-grandchildren, sister, Cleo Sizemore and a host of nieces, nephews, other relatives and friends Services will be at 1:00 PM on Saturday at the Arnett & Steele Funeral Home with Rev. Jimmy Stanley and Rev. David Baker. Music will be by Stephanie Eldridge and David Baker.

Burial will be in the Pinelawn Memorial Gardens, Pineville with grandsons serving as pallbearers.

The family will receive friends on Friday from 6 until 9 PM at the Arnett & Steele Funeral Home, Pineville, which is honored to serve the Slusher Family

[NI28451] Brother's obituary-

Mount Vernon News - (Jan/20/2004)

CONDIT \emdash Harlan "Schoonie" Schoonover Jr., 80, of Condit died at home Sunday, Jan. 18, 2004.He was born April 23, 1923, in Condit. He was a retired carpenter and charter member of Sunbury Eagles, where he also served as maintenance person. He served as a civil service employee for the U.S. Navy and was sent to Pearl Harbor to help restore the damaged battleships following the Japanese attack. Known as an outdoorsman, he loved to fish and hunt.He will be sadly missed by his children, Willard, Robert, Thomas (Pinkie), Michael (Cindy) and Debra (Ronald) Boggs; seven grandchildren; three great-grandchildren; and a host of friends.He was preceded in death by his loving wife of 52 years, Betty (Fleck); his parents, Harlan and Hazel (Lane) Schoonover; a brother, Willard Schoonover; and a sister, Thelma Nuckles.

Friends may call Tuesday from 4 to 8 p.m. at DeVore-Snyder Funeral Home, Ohio 3 at 61, Sunbury, where funeral will be Wednesday at 1 p.m. Pastor Roger Crego will officiate and interment will be in Trenton Cemetery.

[DI28470] Ardith Etta Stanley Nuckles, 89, passed away at her home on June 29, 2012.

Born in Carroll County, Saturday, February 3, 1923 to James Estel and Mary Etta Stanley. She is survived by her loving husband of 69 years Forest E. Nuckles, her children, daughter and son-in-law Judie & Sheldon Gauvreau of Ft. Lauderdale, FL, son and daughter-in-law Jerry & Deborah Nuckles of Wytheville, VA, and daughter Mary Lynn Terry of Woodlawn, VA. Her grandchildren, Steven and Mark Boyles, Christian Newberry, Melissia Selwyn, Judie Lindsey, Jarrett, James, & John Nuckles, 14 great grandchildren and one great-great grandchild. Also, her sisters Glennis Stanley Morris of Galax, Iva Stanley Wagner of Charlotte, NC, and her brother Arville L. Stanley of Laurel Fork, VA.

Ardith was a tireless worker in her church serving at various times as Sunday School teacher, WMU Leader, GA Leader, and choir member. She sang in the choir until she could no longer hear the notes. When she was unable to hear the message, she would read her Bible while the preacher was speaking. She also worked with both Cub Scouts and Girl Scouts. She served as a Lioness for 20 years, and Lion for another 20 years and helped the Ladies of the Moose.

She devoted her life to her husband and children and would still play with the younger ones in the family. She was a superb basketball player and was a ferocious competitor. She played the guitar and sang with her brother and sister in an old time mountain music band on the radio in the 40's.

At home she was always singing while working around the house. She was a very gentle person. She was very protective of her family and devoted to them. She had a positive outlook and always had an easy laugh.

The family will receive friends Sunday, July 1, 2012 at Vaughan-Guynn Funeral Home from 6 until 8 PM. The funeral service will be held Monday, July 2, 2012 at 12 Noon in the First Baptist Church, Galax, VA with Rev. Sam Bartlett officiating. Interment will follow in the Felts Cemetery, Galax, VA.

She is survived by her daughter, Audrey Nuckolls Reynolds and her grandson, F. Richards Reynolds. Graveside services will be held Saturday at 1 p.m. in Woodland Cemetery, Ashland. Memorial gifts may be made to Duncan Memorial United Methodist Church, P.O. Box 247, Ashland, Va. 23005. Arrangements by the Bliley Funeral Home's Staples Mill Chapel.

[DI28530] The Lubbock-Avalanche-Journal

Services for Annie B. Nuckols, 98, of Lubbock will be a 2 p.m. today in Southside Church of Christ with Tommy J. Hicks officiating.Burial will be at 10 a.m. Saturday in Cisco Cemetery under direction of Resthaven Funeral Home.She died Wednesday, April 8, 1998, at her residence.

She was born Jan. 6, 1900, in Fannin County. She moved to Lubbock from Cisco in 1970. She was a member of the Church of Christ. She married Frank J. Nuckols in 1943, in Quanah. Her husband died in 1961. A son died in 1926.She was a retired nurse.Survivors include a daughter, Authella Davis of Shallowater; two sons, Alford Bluhm of Corpus Christi and Balford Bluhm of Lubbock; three sisters, Margaret Bordofske of Abilene, Valorie Finch of Euless and Opal Oden of Wisconsin; two brothers, Eugene Roland of Quanah and William Roland of Colorado Springs, Colo.; three grandchildren; and eight great-grandchildren.

The family suggests memorials to Southside Church of Christ Building Fund.
